wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Alexander Agnew of Dalreagle (1765–1813) was the first Military Governor of British Ceylon in Trincomalee. He was appointed in August 1795 and was governor until 1 March 1796. He was succeeded by James Stuart. In 1811 he became major general of the East India Company.

response: *The Agnews of Dalreagle descend from Alexander Agnew a natural son of Sir Andrew Agnew of Lochnaw 3rd Bt,Burkes Peerage & Baronetage cit. page 47 whose great grandson was Major General Patrick Alexander Agnew 4th of Dalreagle of the Honorable East India Company.
* Patrick Alexander Agnew (1765–1813), governor of British Ceylon, 1795–1796
